title: The TVLine-Up: What’s Returning, New and Leaving the Week of Jan. 19
description: This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch column, our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming, and our master list of Every New TV Show Premiering in 2025. With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or […]
author: Ryan Schwartz
excerpt: TVLine's weekly roundup of the week's premieres and finales includes returning favorites '9-1-1: Lone Star' and 'The Night Agent' — see full schedule.
text: This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch column, our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming, and our master list of Every New TV Show Premiering in 2025. With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or that the new “prestige drama” you anticipated is about to debut. So consider this our reminder to set your DVR, order a Season Pass, pop a fresh Memorex into the VCR… however it is you roll. This week, you’ll find nine returning shows (including The Night Agent and 9-1-1: Lone Star), eight series debuts (including Melissa Roxburgh’s The Hunting Party and Leo Woodall’s Prime Target) and four finales (including The Agency and The Sex Lives of College Girls). SUNDAY, JAN. 197 pm The Hunting Party series premiere (NBC; special night and time) MONDAY, JAN. 207 pm College Football Playoff National Championship (ESPN)8 pm 9-1-1: Lone Star returns (Fox)9 pm Rescue: HI-Surf returns (Fox) TUESDAY, JAN. 213 am Blink Twice streaming premiere (Prime Video)9 pm The Joe Schmo Show reboot premiere (TBS)9 pm The Real Housewives of New York City Season 15 finale (Bravo) WEDNESDAY, JAN. 223 am Prime Target series premiere (Apple TV+; first two episodes)3 am Whiskey on the Rocks limited series premiere (Hulu; all six episodes)3 am W.A.G.s to Riches series premiere (Netflix; all eight episodes)7 pm The Thundermans: Undercover series premiere (Nickelodeon)8 pm The Challenge Season 40 finale (MTV)8 pm The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City Reunion, Part 1 of 3 (Bravo) THURSDAY, JAN. 233 am Carl Weber’s The Family Business: New Orleans series premiere (BET+)3 am Harlem final season premiere (Prime Video; first two episodes)3 am The Night Agent Season 2 premiere (Netflix; all 10 episodes)8 pm Jersey Shore: Family Vacation Season 7 finale (MTV)8 pm Police 24/7 Season 2 premiere (The CW)9 pm C.B. Strike Season 6 premiere (HBO)9 pm Crime Nation Season 2 premiere (The CW)9 pm The Sex Lives of College Girls Season 3 finale (Max) FRIDAY, JAN. 243 am The Agency Season 1 finale (Paramount+ With Showtime)3 am Star Trek: Section 31 movie premiere (Paramount+)3 am The Wild Robot streaming premiere (Peacock)3 am Your Monster streaming premiere (Max)8 pm Penn & Teller: Fool Us Season 11 premiere (The CW)9 pm Masters of Illusion Season 11 premiere (The CW) SATURDAY, JAN. 253 am Saturday Night streaming premiere (Netflix)9 pm Kobe: The Making of a Legend docuseries premiere (CNN) Want scoop on any of the above shows? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line. January Streaming Guide: 80+ Premieres!
html:
This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch column, our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming, and our master list of Every New TV Show Premiering in 2025.

With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or that the new “prestige drama” you anticipated is about to debut. So consider this our reminder to set your DVR, order a Season Pass, pop a fresh Memorex into the VCR… however it is you roll.

This week, you’ll find nine returning shows (including The Night Agent and 9-1-1: Lone Star), eight series debuts (including Melissa Roxburgh’s The Hunting Party and Leo Woodall’s Prime Target) and four finales (including The Agency and The Sex Lives of College Girls).

SUNDAY, JAN. 19
7 pm The Hunting Party series premiere (NBC; special night and time)

MONDAY, JAN. 20
7 pm College Football Playoff National Championship (ESPN)
8 pm 9-1-1: Lone Star returns (Fox)
9 pm Rescue: HI-Surf returns (Fox)

TUESDAY, JAN. 21
3 am Blink Twice streaming premiere (Prime Video)
9 pm The Joe Schmo Show reboot premiere (TBS)
9 pm The Real Housewives of New York City Season 15 finale (Bravo)

WEDNESDAY, JAN. 22
3 am Prime Target series premiere (Apple TV+; first two episodes)
3 am Whiskey on the Rocks limited series premiere (Hulu; all six episodes)
3 am W.A.G.s to Riches series premiere (Netflix; all eight episodes)
7 pm The Thundermans: Undercover series premiere (Nickelodeon)
8 pm The Challenge Season 40 finale (MTV)
8 pm The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City Reunion, Part 1 of 3 (Bravo)

THURSDAY, JAN. 23
3 am Carl Weber’s The Family Business: New Orleans series premiere (BET+)
3 am Harlem final season premiere (Prime Video; first two episodes)
3 am The Night Agent Season 2 premiere (Netflix; all 10 episodes)
8 pm Jersey Shore: Family Vacation Season 7 finale (MTV)
8 pm Police 24/7 Season 2 premiere (The CW)
9 pm C.B. Strike Season 6 premiere (HBO)
9 pm Crime Nation Season 2 premiere (The CW)
9 pm The Sex Lives of College Girls Season 3 finale (Max)

FRIDAY, JAN. 24
3 am The Agency Season 1 finale (Paramount+ With Showtime)
3 am Star Trek: Section 31 movie premiere (Paramount+)
3 am The Wild Robot streaming premiere (Peacock)
3 am Your Monster streaming premiere (Max)
8 pm Penn & Teller: Fool Us Season 11 premiere (The CW)
9 pm Masters of Illusion Season 11 premiere (The CW)

SATURDAY, JAN. 25
3 am Saturday Night streaming premiere (Netflix)
9 pm Kobe: The Making of a Legend docuseries premiere (CNN)

Want scoop on any of the above shows? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line.

January Streaming Guide: 80+ Premieres!
